org.dellroad.stuff.spring
Annotation Type ThreadTransactional

@Documented
@Inherited
@Retention(value=RUNTIME)
@Target(value={TYPE,METHOD})
public @interface ThreadTransactional

Works just like Spring's @Transactional annotation, but instead of using a fixed PlatformTransactionManager stored in a static variable and determined once at startup, this annotation uses a PlatformTransactionManager found dynamically at runtime in the application context that is associated with the current thread by the ThreadLocalContext singleton. This allows the same transactional class to be instantiated in different application contexts with different transaction managers.

Stated another way, @ThreadConfigurable does for @Transactional what @ThreadConfigurable does for @Configurable. See @ThreadConfigurable for further discussion.

This annotation does not require or use the <tx:annotation-driven/> XML declaration. As with @Transactional, if you need to specifiy a specific PlatformTransactionManager by name, you can do that by setting the annotation value().

If a @ThreadTransactional-annotated method is invoked and no application context has been configured for the current thread, and there is no default set by way of the ThreadLocalContext singleton, then an IllegalStateException is thrown.

Running the AspectJ compiler on your annotated classes is required to activate this annotation.

See Also:
ThreadTransactional, ThreadLocalContext, Transactional
